responsibilities: Utilize statistical techniques to analyze and extract relevant information from large amounts of data
Automate and optimize data extraction, cleaning, processing, and analysis functions
Develop, validate, and implement data models to solve problems/answer questions
Develop and implement novel statistical approaches to address complex issues
Perform data science/engineering with little guidance and independently write reports detailing methods, results, and impacts to assigned issues
Support in the acquisition of systems, software, and data science-related capabilities
skills: Proficiency in statistics packages such as SPSS, SAS, S-PLUS, and R
Programming skills sufficient to extract, transform, and clean multi-terabyte databases
Demonstrate understanding of statistical analysis such as regression, anomaly detection, and clustering
Ability to combine a diverse set of data sources containing multiple forms of information
Demonstrated ability to use technical and analytic skills to solve complex problems
Effective communication skills to relay data science activities, technical findings, and data products for both technical and non-technical customers
analysis: The job responsibilities and skills listed focus primarily on data analysis, statistical techniques, and data science. The responsibilities include tasks such as analyzing large datasets, automating data processes, developing data models, and implementing statistical approaches. The skills required include proficiency in statistical software, programming for data manipulation, and understanding statistical analysis methods. There is no mention of working with Generative AI or language models (LLMs) specifically. The focus is on traditional data science and statistical analysis rather than on developing or working with GenAI or LLMs.
